request.description: Creates an order under the provided enterprise unit and organization
Gets an Order. The order ID is automatically saved when calling Create. The '{{order-id}}' in the request URL can be replaced by a different order id.
Creates an order under the provided enterprise unit and organization
This call replaces the entire Order, referenced by the order id, with the provided order data.

Patches an Order. Only the fields that are specified in the body of the request will be updated, while the rest will remain unchanged on the order. Specified line items can be updated if the lineId is provided, while new line IDs or line items without an ID will be created and added to that collection.
Creates a Transaction in the organization.
Retrieves a transaction in an organization. The tlog ID is automatically saved when calling Create. The '{{tlog-id}}' in the request URL can be replaced by a different transactoin id.
Searches for transactions matching provided criteria in an organization
Updates/creates an item's fields for the input item.
Retrieves full item document by item identifier (code).

Catalog Finder Api: 
   
   Accept query params to search upon:
      You can search upon:
      
         1. itemCodePattern
         2. packageIdentifierPattern
         3. longDescriptionPattern
         4. shortDescriptionPattern
         5. itemStatus (Enum accepts ACTIVE OR INACTIVE)
         6. categoryCode
         7. sortField (Can be short or long description,Item code
         8. sortDirection (ASC OR DESC)
         
     Above searchable fields can have values in the form of pattern using solr wild card search.
     
Note : Look if you are searchiing for the same organization or not. If user is in different org you get the results only for the respective org.
       
       For simple testing use the root(/)  org and catalog_user as credentials.
       For testing with different orgs you need to create user who has catlog roles,  and assign an organization with catalog roles to that user.
       
NOTE :Query is an AND operation

### Find By Criteria
##### Query Params
* pageNumber: Int
* pageSize: Int

### Finds nearby Sites
Be sure to fill lat,lon in path with desired values
##### Query params
* radius: Int
* numSites: Int
* customAttributes: Array

request.description: Update consumer will do a full replace of a consumer. If fields are missing it will be omitted while re-creating the consumer
Find consumer in your organization using a `searchCriteria`. Refer to Devex for all supported `searchCriteria`

item.name: Retrieve all images of an org

request.description:
### *Find By Criteria*

This call retrieves all images of an organization or an enterprise unit that meet the specified criteria request.

__In order to be retrieved, the search criteria must be an exact match for the attributes of the searched image.__

The specified search criteria includes: 

```Json
{
    "pageNumber": 0,
    "pageSize": 200,
    "fileNamePattern": "String",
    "imageNamePattern": "String",
    "imageTagPattern": "String",
    "imageSortCriteria": {
        "sortFields": [
            "FILE_NAME",
            "FILE_SIZE",
            "UPLOAD_DATE_TIME"
        ],
        "sortDirection": "ASC"
    }
}
```

item.name: Retrieves multiple images for an org

request.description:
### *Get By Image ID*

Get an image by its image ID.

### *Patch Image Metadata*

Patch the metadata of an image by its unique identifier.

### *Replace an image* Replace an image, and optionally update its metadata properties. __In order for an image to be replaced, an image file must be selected within the body before the call is sent.__ Appropriate image file types include:
  • .jpg
  • .png
  • .gif
__The Multipart/Form-Data must include the following:__ | Key | Value | Content Type | | ------------------------ | ------------------------ | ------------------------ | | imageFile | Replaced Image File | application/octet-stream | | imageUpdateRequest | Json Data Body | application/json | ```Json { "imageName": "String", "tags": [ "tag1", "tag2" ], "fileName": "fileName", "status": "ACTIVE" } ```

formdata.description: Add your image to the value field with the Select Files button.(JPG, PNG, GIF)

request.description:
### *Upload an image* Upload an image with a unique image identifier __In order for an image to be uploaded, an image file must be selected within the body before the call is sent.__ Appropriate image file types include:
  • .jpg
  • .png
  • .gif
__The Multipart/Form-Data must include the following:__ | Key | Value | Content Type | | ------------------------ | ------------------------ | ------------------------ | | imageFile | Uploaded Image File | application/octet-stream | | imageWriteDate | Json Data Body | application/json | ```Json { "imageName": "String", "tags": [ "tag1", "tag2" ], "id": "imageID", "fileName": "fileName", "status": "ACTIVE" } ```
